Detailed Description

Simple Collider that flattens a heirarchy of Collidable/CollidableGroups into a flat set of CollidableBodys. i.e. listeners will only be called with CollidableBodys, no CollidableGroups will be passed through - instead all combinations of pairs of CollidableBodys from any group will be passed. This is useful to pass to a CollisionDetector, which only accepts CollidableBodys.

virtual void physics::FlattenCollider::collide (  ref< const Collidable >    collidable )  [inline, virtual]
 

convenience method that calls collide(collidable1, collidable2) for each pair of Collidables in the group collidable, unless collidable isn't a group (so that you can keep all your Collidables in a single top-level group)

Reimplemented from physics::Collider.

bool base::Referenced::unreference (    )  const [inline, inherited]
